intro: Erigeron thrincioides, commonly known as the thrincoides fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron thrincioides is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ecological value for pollinators.
